result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles A. Parham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: each other and any other sentence defendant is currently serving

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, 10 hours community service per week.
Absolute sobriety except prescriptions taken as prescribed and with authorization of agent.

Payment of court costs including buy money unless it comes out of the money that was voluntarily surrendered by the defendant. 
Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the department. 
Court finds the defendant is not eligible for CIP or SAP. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

Case Called: 4:32 pm 
INCLUDES 13CF574 AND 14CF782. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in person with Atty Angela Henderson. 
Date and time set for hearing on deft's postconviction motions. 
State notes parties have reached agreement regarding motions and notes agreement of the parties. 
Atty Henderson withdraws motion re: CIP/SAP.
COURT vacates DNA surcharge. 
COURT notes June 2nd letter from DOC. 
State notes issue raised in DOC letter was addressed by stipulation. 
State notes motions on CCAP re: competency and sentence credit which it has not received. 
COURT sets calendar call on 10/14/2015 at 1pm with Br. 3 - Atty Henderson may appear by phone. 
Atty Henderson states belief that DNA surcharge has been paid and requests surcharge to refunded and placed in prison account. 
COURT ORDERS: DNA surcharge refunded if it has been paid as requested. 
Deft makes statement re: buy money. 
Atty Henderson notes she is unable to represent deft on financial issue raised. 
COURT advises deft to file letter/motion on issue regarding buy money.

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 11:22 am 
INCLUDES 13CF574 AND 14CF782. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Stephen Sawyer.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.

State moves to: 
In 13CF574: Ct. 3 (Manufacture/Deliver Heroin/Repeater/2nd and Subsequent Offense)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place/Repeater/2nd and Subsequent Offense/PTAC)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 5 (Possess with Intent - Heroin/PTAC/2nd and Subsequent Offense/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 6 (Possess with Intent - Amphetamine/2nd and Subsequent Offense/PTAC/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 7 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/PTAC/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 8 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 14CF782: Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 5 (Manufacture/Deliver Heroin/2nd and Subsequent Offense/Possession with Intent to Deliver a Controlled Substance on or near a Park)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 6 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 7 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/PTAC)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 8 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 9 (Possession of Controlled Substance)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 10 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 13CF574: Ct. 1 (Manufacture/Deliver Heroin/Repeater/2nd and Subsequent Offense)>>GUILTY. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Manufacture/Deliver Heroin/Repeater/2nd and Subsequent Offense)>>GUILTY. 
In 14CF782: Ct. 1 (Manufacture/Deliver Heroin/2nd and Subsequent Offense/Possession with Intent to Deliver a Controlled Substance on or near a Park)>>GUILTY. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Manufacture/Deliver Heroin/2nd and Subsequent Offense/Possession with Intent to Deliver a Controlled Substance on or near a Park)>>GUILTY.  

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Atty Sawyer makes statement. Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: In 13CF574: Ct. 1>>16 years imprisonment - 8 years IC and 8 years ES. 
                                                 : Ct. 2>>16 years imprisonment - 8 years IC and 8 years ES. 
                            : In 14CF782: Ct. 1>>20 years imprisonment - 8 years IC and 12 years ES. 
                                                  : Ct. 3>> 20 years imprisonment - 8 years IC and 12 years ES. 
COURT ORDERS all sentences to run concurrent to each other and any other sentence def is currently serving. 
COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS OF ES IN ALL: payment of court costs including buy money unless it comes out of the money that was voluntarily surrendered by the def; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, 10 hours community service per week; absolute sobriety except prescriptions taken as prescribed and with authorization of agent; AODA; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept. 
COURT finds def is entitled to 56 days credit in 14CF782 and NO days jail credit in 13CF574 - COURT notes parties may submit stipulation regarding jail credit in 13CF574. 
COURT finds the def is NOT eligible for CIP or SAP. 
COURT remands def to sheriff's dept for transportation to WI State Prison System. 
Adj: 11:49 AM
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection
